prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here is a bub:
1. Dalmatian

Now pick out the other bubs from the following list:
1. carrot
2. bee
3. onion
4. loader
5. green bell pepper
6. eggplant
7. basset hound
8. Labrador
9. cat
10. red bell pepper
11. box truck
12. bear
13. yellow bell pepper
14. chiller truck
15. school bus
16. car
17. seal
18. pumpkin
19. crane
20. Dalmatian
21. full-trailer truck


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. full-trailer truck and motorcycle
2. motorcycle and onion
3. toucan and carrot
4. green bell pepper and basset hound
5. motorcycle and cat
6. garbage truck and bear
7. red bell pepper and semi-trailer truck
8. red bell pepper and pumpkin
9. potato and seal
10. motorcycle and red bell pepper
11. chiller truck and bee
12. toucan and crane
13. basset hound and bear
14. chiller truck and green bell pepper
15. potato and tractor
16. basset hound and red bell pepper
17. car and crane
18. potato and school bus
19. carrot and tractor
20. terrier and red bell pepper
21. chiller truck and red bell pepper
22. Dalmatian and Labrador
23. crane and seal
24. motorcycle and eggplant
25. garbage truck and onion
26. mutt and yellow bell pepper
27. carrot and box truck
28. chiller truck and school bus
29. cat and basset hound
30. green bell pepper and onion
31. green bell pepper and semi-trailer truck
32. semi-trailer truck and yellow bell pepper
33. terrier and onion
34. Dalmatian and carrot
35. green bell pepper and Dalmatian
36. green bell pepper and mutt
37. yellow bell pepper and seal
38. eggplant and pumpkin
39. loader and seal
40. potato and cat
41. Dalmatian and semi-trailer truck
42. Labrador and bee
43. car and box truck
44. red bell pepper and garbage truck
45. full-trailer truck and Dalmatian
46. school bus and bear
47. full-trailer truck and car
48. pig and tractor
49. basset hound and carrot
50. car and toucan


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
